intro: Celosia argentea var. cristata, commonly known as the plume cockscomb, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its unique, feathery inflorescence that resembles a comb or plume, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its vibrant red, pink, or orange flowers bloom throughout the growing season, making it a popular ornamental plant. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, adding to its visual appeal.
